abstract: Corey Rubin serves up a slow-smoked Southern crossword.
snippet: Corey Rubin serves up a slow-smoked Southern crossword.
lead_paragraph: Corey Rubin uses every letter of the alphabet in this Friday crossword with several unusual words and phrases. Sixteen answers make their debut, including FENWAY, just in time for ball season, and the verbified eponym MIRANDIZE meaning “Read rights to.” To me, the oddest debut was DAY-PEEP, a poetic way to refer to the “Crack of dawn.” Apparently Milton used it. And ladies, if you’re looking for “The perfect match,” you can find MR. RIGHT in the grid for the first time at 32 Down.

abstract: Drug companies say Food and Drug Administration regulations must take into account the realities of Internet search ads.
snippet: Drug companies say Food and Drug Administration regulations must take into account the realities of Internet search ads.
lead_paragraph: WHEN the Food and Drug Administration sent letters to 14 major pharmaceutical companies late last month, the warning was strong. The companies’ search advertisements  the short text ads that run beside Google results  had to start including risk information about each drug or else be rewritten or removed.

headline.main: F.D.A. Rules on Drug Ads Sow Confusion as Applied to Web
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Rules on Drug Ads Sow Confusion as Applied to Web

abstract: For now, the best one can say is that China is still merely the least-sick patient on the ward.
snippet: For now, the best one can say is that China is still merely the least-sick patient on the ward.
lead_paragraph: China just reported that it has had the lowest quarterly increase in its economy since 1992. That’s not good news — but it’s not as bad as it sounds. Certainly, the 6.1 percent rise still shames the rest of the world — Singapore’s economy has just shrunk twice as fast as China’s grew. More important, there are signs that Premier Wen Jiabao’s $585 billion stimulus is taking effect. The problem now isn’t the efficacy of the medicine but the severity of the side effects.

headline.main: Signs of Health Stirring in China
headline.print_headline: Signs of Health Stirring in China

abstract: The Internet Archive and others detail their objections to the Google books settlement.
snippet: The Internet Archive and others detail their objections to the Google books settlement.
lead_paragraph: Updated at 8:10 p.m. to include reference to new article by Pamela Samuelson.With a May 5 deadline for filing objections to the Google books settlement looming, opposition to and criticism of the settlement continues to cement.

headline.main: Opposition to Google Books Settlement Jells
